author: Special Correspondent
text:
A policeman, attached to Manamadurai police station, has been booked under provisions of Prevention of Cruelty to Animals for beating a dog after trespassing into the house owned by his father-in-law and occupied by a woman at Ismailpuram in the city.

The police have charged the policeman Jothiram with having forcefully entered into the house where a widow, P. Veni (45), was living. After breaking the door, he had beaten the dog.

The woman said he had threatened her to vacate the house.

Based on a complaint, Vilakkuthoon police arrested him and let him off on personal bail.
title: Policeman booked for beating dog
